Articles.Content:
Pretty sure thats what he meant. You cant exactly do a grand tour with only 2 planets now can you...

You can, it's just a pretty rubbish grand tour.

I don't want it to be rushed, but judging from the Planned changes, it shouldn't be much longer. One or two major changes left.

I think it's against the rules to speculate as well, just a little notice.

Anyway, I love the look so far, also, Nova, you need to vanillaize some of those BACE parts, maybe improve them a little if possible. Not because I don't want to use a mod, but I think it would be a way to update it a little.

DunaLab! The first space station scheduled to be placed in orbit around another planet.

Addendum:

Addendum:

snip

wow i love the detail on the planet!
I may be mistaken, but there doesn't appear to be any atmosphere around that planet... was this just a pic from earlier in development?

I may be mistaken, but there doesn't appear to be any atmosphere around that planet... was this just a pic from earlier in development?

I notice that too. Looks like a big moon still it is very nice.
When you say Duna has a thinner atmosphere, is that less dense, or it doesn't extend as high as Kerbins?

You can't see atmosphere on Kerbin at that distance, either.

Also, here's the launcher:
Wow Duna looks amazing, I can't wait to put stations above all the planets!
You make interesting uses of the Tail part... Also, that design is what I normally use in my Minmus rockets.
Nova, where did you get those retro rockets? I've been looking for them forever :c

Nova, where did you get those retro rockets? I've been looking for them forever :c

You mean the mini SRBs?

Theyre not in the game yet. Wait till 0.17

P.S Theres some really nice looking retro rockets in the kethane addons
oh, they're vanilla parts? excuse me while I s**t my pants in excitement

You can't see atmosphere on Kerbin at that distance, either.

Also, here's the launcher:

[snip]

Wow that is a impressively large object to send so far, also the launcher is tiny compared to what I am considering... I'm am amazed it has enough power.

Also interesting use of tail cones to add lateral stability, I'm starting to think Nova likes to make the wackiest rocket he can.

oh, they're vanilla parts? excuse me while I s**t my pants in excitement

The fuel and engines look to be stock, the actual "space station" is made from mod parts that nova made.

In other words, nothing that would make this any easier.

You can't see atmosphere on Kerbin at that distance, either.

Also, here's the launcher:

yay a 2m to 1m adaptor!

The Kosmos pack has excellent little jettison-able structure things to attach struts to. They're designed to accomplish what you appear to be using the tail part or. But maybe you use it for style lol.

yay a 2m to 1m adaptor!

This is I do not like the KSP that you can build a rocket with no aerodynamic design, and it still fly to the obit. I saw a video on YouTube as one built on the ground, *entire space station;-)

You can't see atmosphere on Kerbin at that distance, either.

Also, here's the launcher:

That's smaller than my Mun rocket.
The 3m parts must have been corrected. I can barely get a similar design into a low-ish orbit as they are in 0.16.

The 3m parts must have been corrected. I can barely get a similar design into a low-ish orbit as they are in 0.16.

I think you mean 2m, 3m is much bigger.
Technically it's 2.5 meters, but I digress. Nova, does that rocket have a tight fuel budget?

Technically it's 2.5 meters, but I digress. Nova, does that rocket have a tight fuel budget?

Well, I ejected the departure stage with a bit of fuel left, and had to perform an aerocapture once I reached Duna, so, yes, to an extent.

You can't see atmosphere on Kerbin at that distance, either.

Also, here's the launcher:

Grrrrrr..... I wish I could build a rover That planet has so much detail, also, what is it called?

It's cool that you've tuned the atmosphere such that the aerobraking-parachute-rocket combo that works on Mars is also appropriate for Duna.

Only in KSP though could you use aerobraking to slow down a space station. lol

Edited September 2, 2012 by nhnifong
